sentences.sContent: Some biologists, along with Plato, define hominid as “featherless biped.”
sentences.sContent_eng: Some biologists, along with Plato, define hominid as “featherless biped.”
sentences.sCn: 有些生物学家，作为柏拉图的跟随者，定义原始人类为“没有羽毛的两足动物” 。

sentences.sContent: "It is still difficult for a biped robot to walk on a bumpy surface, even on Earth," the official said.
sentences.sContent_eng: "It is still difficult for a biped robot to walk on a bumpy surface, even on Earth," the official said.
sentences.sCn: 这位官员说，“即使是在地球上，两足机器人在颠簸的路面行走仍然有困难。”

sentences.sContent: Whether it's through the forest or across the savanna, it doesn't matter — you're a biped when you're moving, " Jungers says.
sentences.sContent_eng: Whether it's through the forest or across the savanna, it doesn't matter — you're a biped when you're moving, " Jungers says.
sentences.sCn: 无论是穿过森林或是走过热带稀树草原都没关系，当你运动时，你就是一只两足动物，”容格斯说。

remMethod.val: bi (两个， 二) + ped (足， 脚) → 两足动物

trans.tranOther: an animal with two legs, such as a human
